name: fatty acid binding protein 1

biocarta.name: mechanism of gene regulation by peroxisome proliferators via ppara

kegg.name: Fat digestion and absorption - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Regulation of lipid metabolism by PPARalpha

summary: This gene encodes the fatty acid binding protein found in liver. Fatty acid binding proteins are a family of small, highly conserved, cytoplasmic proteins that bind long-chain fatty acids and other hydrophobic ligands. This protein and FABP6 (the ileal fatty acid binding protein) are also able to bind bile acids. It is thought that FABPs roles include fatty acid uptake, transport, and metabolism. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2011].
